lesson_title: Daily Routine Conversations: What I Do Every Day
objectives: Learn words and phrases to describe daily activities from morning to night.
Understand and use time expressions correctly when talking about routine.
Practice having simple conversations about daily schedules and activities.

sections.text: A daily routine is a list of things you do every day, usually at the same time. Having a routine helps you organize your day. It includes all your activities from when you wake up until you sleep.

examples.label: Morning Routine
examples.value: Waking up, brushing teeth, bathing, eating breakfast, going to school.

examples.label: Afternoon Routine
examples.value: Studying at school, eating lunch, playing with friends.

examples.label: Evening Routine
examples.value: Coming home, doing homework, eating dinner, sleeping.

examples.label: Daily Tasks
examples.value: The regular work you have to do each day.

examples.label: Schedule
examples.value: A plan for your time.

usage_examples: My **daily routine** starts early in the morning.
Following a **routine** helps me finish all my tasks.
What is your **routine** after school?
Every day, I do the same **activities**.
Our family has a fixed **routine** for meals.
A good **schedule** helps you manage your time.
My **daily tasks** include studying and helping my parents.
It is a good **habit** to wake up early.
Part of my **routine** is to read a book every night.
My father's **daily routine** is very busy.
I write my **schedule** in a notebook.
Playing in the evening is my favorite **activity**.
Eating meals on time is a healthy **routine**.
I try to follow my **routine** every day.
My mother helps me plan my **daily schedule**.

sections.text: The first part of our day starts with waking up and getting ready for school or work. These are common actions we do every morning.

examples.label: Wake up
examples.value: To stop sleeping and open your eyes.

examples.label: Brush teeth
examples.value: To clean your teeth with a toothbrush and toothpaste.

examples.label: Take a bath
examples.value: To wash your body with water and soap.

examples.label: Get dressed
examples.value: To put on your clothes.

examples.label: Comb hair
examples.value: To make your hair neat with a comb.

examples.label: Make the bed
examples.value: To arrange the sheets and blankets neatly on your bed.

examples.label: Wash face
examples.value: To clean your face with water.

examples.label: Pray
examples.value: To talk to God.

usage_examples: I **wake up** at 6 AM every day.
First, I **brush my teeth**.
Then, I **take a bath** with fresh well water.
I **get dressed** in my school uniform.
My sister **combs her hair** neatly.
My father **wakes up** before sunrise.
We **wash our face** every morning.
Always **clean your hands** before eating.
After waking up, I feel fresh.
My mother **prepares** our clothes.
I always **make my bed** after I wake up.
My grandmother **prays** in the morning.
I **put on** my shoes and socks.
It is important to **start the day** with a positive mind.
My routine is to **exercise** for 15 minutes in the morning.

sections.text: After getting ready, we usually have our first meal of the day and then head out for school or work.

examples.label: Eat breakfast
examples.value: To have the first meal of the day, usually in the morning.

examples.label: Drink milk/tea
examples.value: To have a glass of milk or tea.

examples.label: Pack bag
examples.value: To put books, lunchbox, and other things in your school bag.

examples.label: Go to school/farm
examples.value: To leave home and go to school or the farm.

examples.label: Leave home
examples.value: To exit your house to go somewhere.

examples.label: Catch the bus
examples.value: To get on the bus.

examples.label: Say goodbye
examples.value: To say farewell to family members.

usage_examples: At 7 AM, I **eat breakfast** with my family.
My father **drinks tea** before going to the farm.
I **pack my school bag** with all my books.
We **go to school** at 8 AM every morning.
My mother **prepares** hot rotis for breakfast.
My elder brother **helps** my father on the farm.
I **walk** to school with my friends.
Some students **ride bicycles** to school.
We carry our **lunchbox** and **water bottle**.
My father **leaves for the farm** early.
I always **say goodbye** to my mother before leaving.
I have to hurry to **catch the bus**.
I **finish my breakfast** quickly.
It is important to have a healthy **breakfast**.
I check my bag to make sure I have all my **books**.

sections.text: During the afternoon, we spend most of our time at school, learning and doing different activities. Adults are usually at their work.

examples.label: Study
examples.value: To learn or read subjects in school.

examples.label: Learn
examples.value: To get new knowledge or skills.

examples.label: Attend classes
examples.value: To be present in lessons given by the teacher.

examples.label: Play games
examples.value: To engage in sports or fun activities during break time.

examples.label: Write notes
examples.value: To write down important points from the lesson.

examples.label: Ask questions
examples.value: To ask the teacher when you have a doubt.

examples.label: Work hard
examples.value: To put a lot of effort into a task.

usage_examples: At school, I **study** English and Maths.
We **learn** many new things from our teachers.
I **attend classes** from 9 AM to 4 PM.
During lunch break, we **play games** in the playground.
My friends and I **do our assignments** together.
The teachers **teach** us well.
We **listen** carefully in class.
My father **works** hard on the farm in the afternoon.
He **irrigates** the fields.
My mother **rests** for some time after finishing household chores.
In science class, we **do experiments**.
I always **write notes** in my notebook.
It is important to **ask questions** if you don't understand.
We **participate** in classroom activities.
My father **takes a break** for lunch in the fields.

sections.text: Lunch is our midday meal. It's a time to relax and refuel before continuing with our activities.

examples.label: Have lunch
examples.value: To eat the midday meal.

examples.label: Share lunch
examples.value: To give some of your food to others and they give you some of theirs.

examples.label: Wash hands
examples.value: To clean your hands before and after eating.

examples.label: Eat together
examples.value: To eat with friends or family.

examples.label: Open lunchbox
examples.value: To open the container with your food.

usage_examples: I **have lunch** at 12 PM at school.
My friends and I **share lunch** in the cafeteria.
Always **wash your hands** before eating lunch.
My mother packs tasty food in my **lunchbox**.
We **eat** rice and dal for lunch.
It's good to **eat together**.
I drink water from my **water bottle** during lunch.
The school bell rings for the **lunch break**.
I am always hungry at **lunch time**.
After I **finish my lunch**, I play for some time.
I like to **sit under a tree** and eat my lunch.
We talk and laugh while we **eat lunch**.
My friend brings delicious pickles in his **lunchbox**.
I thank my mother for the tasty **lunch**.
We clean the area after we **have our lunch**.

sections.text: After school or work, we return home. Evenings are for relaxation, helping family, and doing homework.

examples.label: Come home
examples.value: To return to your house.

examples.label: Change clothes
examples.value: To put on different clothes, usually more comfortable ones.

examples.label: Do homework
examples.value: To complete school work given by the teacher to be done at home.

examples.label: Help with chores
examples.value: To assist with tasks around the house like fetching water or cleaning.

examples.label: Play outside
examples.value: To go out and play games or with friends.

examples.label: Feed the animals
examples.value: To give food to cattle or pets.

examples.label: Study
examples.value: To revise lessons or prepare for tests.

examples.label: Relax
examples.value: To rest and become less tense.

usage_examples: I **come home** at 4 PM from school.
First, I **change my clothes**.
Then, I **do my homework** in my room.
I **help my mother with chores**, like fetching water.
In the evening, I **play outside** with my friends.
My father **comes home** from the farm after sunset.
My sister **waters the plants** in the garden.
We **take care** of our animals.
I **study for my exams** in the evening.
After playing, I **wash my hands and feet**.
My brother **feeds the cows** and goats.
Sometimes I just **relax** and talk to my grandmother.
We **light the lamp** in the prayer room in the evening.
My mother **prepares snacks** for us.
I finish all my **studying** before dinner.

sections.text: The end of the day usually involves dinner with family and then getting ready for sleep to be fresh for the next day.

examples.label: Eat dinner
examples.value: To have the last meal of the day, usually in the evening.

examples.label: Talk with family
examples.value: To have conversations and share your day with parents and siblings.

examples.label: Read a book
examples.value: To look at and understand a story or lesson from a book before bed.

examples.label: Go to sleep / Go to bed
examples.value: To start sleeping, to rest for the night.

examples.label: Watch TV
examples.value: To watch shows on television.

examples.label: Listen to stories
examples.value: To hear tales from elders.

examples.label: Say goodnight
examples.value: To wish someone a good night's sleep.

usage_examples: At 8 PM, we all **eat dinner** together.
After dinner, we **talk with our family**.
Sometimes, I **read a book** before **going to sleep**.
My mother tells us bedtime stories.
I **sleep** at 9 PM to get enough rest.
My grandmother **sings** lullabies.
We thank God for the day before **sleeping**.
My family **watches TV** for half an hour.
I **go to bed** early so I can wake up fresh.
We discuss our day while we **have dinner**.
I **say goodnight** to everyone before I sleep.
I like to **listen to stories** from my grandfather.
My father checks that all the **doors are locked** at night.
It is important to get 8 hours of **sleep**.
I feel tired and **go to sleep**.

sections.text: We use 'at' before a specific time to say exactly when something happens.

examples.label: At 6 AM
examples.value: I wake up **at 6 AM**.

examples.label: At 8 o'clock
examples.value: School starts **at 8 o'clock**.

examples.label: At noon
examples.value: We have lunch **at noon** (12 PM).

examples.label: At night
examples.value: The stars shine **at night**.

examples.label: At sunset
examples.value: The farmers return home **at sunset**.

examples.label: At midnight
examples.value: It is very quiet **at midnight**.

usage_examples: My father leaves for the farm **at 7 AM**.
We eat dinner **at 8 PM**.
The school bell rings **at 9 o'clock**.
I usually play outside **at 5 PM**.
The sun rises **at 6 AM**.
We sleep **at 9:30 PM**.
The market opens **at 10 AM**.
My favourite TV show is **at 8:30 PM**.
I have my lunch break **at 12:30 PM**.
He comes back from work **at 6 PM**.
I have to meet my friend **at 4 o'clock**.
The cows are milked **at sunrise**.
We light the prayer lamp **at dusk**.
The moon is beautiful **at night**.
My alarm clock rings **at 5:30 AM**.

subtopics.title: 5.2. Talking About Parts of the Day ('in the')

sections.text: We use 'in the' to talk about broader parts of the day. Note: We say 'at night', not 'in the night'.

examples.label: In the morning
examples.value: I pray **in the morning**.

examples.label: In the afternoon
examples.value: We study **in the afternoon**.

examples.label: In the evening
examples.value: Children play **in the evening**.

examples.label: At night
examples.value: I sleep soundly **at night**.

usage_examples: Birds sing **in the morning**.
It gets very hot **in the afternoon**.
My family watches TV **in the evening**.
We do our homework **in the afternoon** after school.
Farmers work hard **in the morning** and **in the evening**.
I drink water **in the morning**.
The sun is strongest **in the afternoon**.
The air becomes cool **in the evening**.
I feel fresh and energetic **in the morning**.
My mother takes a nap **in the afternoon**.
My father reads the newspaper **in the morning**.
We water our plants **in the evening**.
I help my mother in the kitchen **in the evening**.
I revise my lessons **in the morning** before school.
It is peaceful **in the early morning**.

sections.text: We use 'before' to talk about something that happens earlier, and 'after' for something that happens later.

examples.label: Before
examples.value: I brush my teeth **before** eating breakfast.

examples.label: After
examples.value: I play **after** doing my homework.

examples.label: Before School
examples.value: I take a bath **before** school.

examples.label: After Dinner
examples.value: We talk with family **after** dinner.

examples.label: Before Sunset
examples.value: The animals must be brought home **before** sunset.

examples.label: After Rain
examples.value: The air smells fresh **after** the rain.

usage_examples: Always wash your hands **before** eating.
I feel tired **after** playing cricket.
My mother lights the lamp **before** sunset.
We go to sleep **after** finishing all our work.
Farmers irrigate the fields **before** sowing seeds.
I revise my lessons **after** class.
He eats fruit **before** going to bed.
I pack my bag **before** sleeping.
We clean the dining area **after** every meal.
**Before** leaving home, I touch my parents' feet.
**After** coming home, I wash my face and hands.
He helps his father on the farm **after** school.
We watch the news **after** dinner.
You must finish your homework **before** you can play.
The village becomes quiet **after** 10 PM.

sections.text: To talk about things that happen regularly, we use 'every day', 'every week', 'every month', etc.

examples.label: Every day
examples.value: I go to school **every day**.

examples.label: Every week
examples.value: We visit the market **every week**.

examples.label: Every month
examples.value: My father goes to the city **every month**.

examples.label: Every year
examples.value: We celebrate the village festival **every year**.

examples.label: Every morning
examples.value: My grandfather reads the newspaper **every morning**.

examples.label: Every night
examples.value: I pray **every night** before sleeping.

usage_examples: I drink milk **every day**.
We clean our house **every week**.
The teacher gives us new homework **every day**.
My family visits the temple **every month**.
The postman delivers mail **every day**.
We get fresh vegetables **every week** from the farm.
The principal conducts assembly **every morning**.
My aunt visits us **every Sunday**.
We get our pocket money **every month**.
My birthday comes **every year**.
I brush my teeth **every morning** and **every night**.
The bus to the city comes **every hour**.
We have a holiday **every second Saturday**.
My father checks his crops **every day**.
We play cricket with our friends **every evening**.

table.title: Time Expressions
rows: at 7 AM, at noon, at night
in the morning, in the afternoon, in the evening
We go to market every week.
We go on vacation every year.
I usually play in the evening.
I never go to bed late.
